error.signature: Your branch is behind 'origin/main' by N commits, and can be fast-forwarded
error.regex: Your branch is behind .* by \d+ commit

verdict.summary: Local branch is behind the remote tracking branch. New commits exist on the remote that haven't been pulled. This is informational but can lead to rejected pushes if local commits are also present.

dead_ends.action: Using git push --force to overwrite remote with local state
dead_ends.why_fails: Force push overwrites the remote commits that others may depend on. This causes history rewriting for all collaborators and can lose other people's work.

dead_ends.action: Ignoring the message and continuing to work without pulling
dead_ends.why_fails: Each new local commit increases divergence. Eventually git push will be rejected, requiring a more complex merge or rebase.

workarounds.action: Pull to fast-forward your local branch
workarounds.how:
git pull origin main
# Or if you prefer rebase:
git pull --rebase origin main

workarounds.action: Rebase local commits on top of the updated remote
workarounds.how:
git fetch origin
git rebase origin/main
# Resolve any conflicts, then:
git push origin main

leads_to.condition: Local commits exist and push is attempted without pulling first

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'Branch is behind' means only remote has new commits (can fast-forward). 'Diverged' means both local and remote have new commits (requires merge or rebase).
